PRIMUS AUDITING OPERATIONS
SUSTAINABILITY AUDIT SERVICES AGREEMENT
div.p: Please sign and return this Services Agreement (the “Agreement”) within 24 hours of receipt. JS Audit Group, Inc., dba Primus Auditing Operations (“Primus Auditing Ops”) is not responsible for changes to estimated costs or any additional costs incurred when Service Agreements are returned late. All estimates are calculated in U.S. dollars.

b.i: Services to be delivered by Primus Auditing Operations

div.p:
Estimated Travel Expenses: - Travel expenses are estimated and are subject to change based on actual travel expenses incurred.
Travel expenses are on a direct reimbursement basis and include all expenses for transportation, accommodation and meals. Whenever possible trips are combined with other business and expenses are divided to reduce the total cost for all of our customers.
1. SERVICES and DELIVERY. Primus Auditing Ops shall perform and inspection and Audit of Customer's operations, against the Sustainable Food Group Sustainability Standard Scheme, and compliant with the Sustainability Standard General Regulations, and utilizing an approved auditor from or contracted by Primus Auditing Ops. Within 15 days following the inspection of the operation, Primus Auditing Ops shall provide results of the Inspection and Audit to Customer, indicating where corrective actions can or must be made by Customer. Customer shall have thirty (30) calendar days following the date of the inspection to send the applicable corrective actions to PAO utilizing the Azzule Auditing Software. If Customer fails to submit corrective actions within that 30 day window, the audit is considered closed and there will be no possibility to modify Customer's level of compliance.
Upon Customer's achievement of certification under the Sustainability Standard TM and its general regulations, Primus Auditing Ops shall issue Customer a certificate indicating Customer's compliance with the Sustainability Standard TM audit. Certification is valid for the three year period following the certification date. Note that audit reports and certificates are sent electronically to Customer via email and will be uploaded directly by Primus Auditing Ops to the Azzule Systems Database. Hardcopies are available upon Customer's request.
2. DATA OWNERSHIP. Customer acknowledges and agrees all data submitted by Primus Auditing Ops into the Primus Auditing Ops database and/or Azzule Systems database becomes the sole and exclusive property of Azzule Systems (“Azzule”). Azzule may use Customer's data to create anonymized data sets. Data sets are not associated with any individual Customer. Azzule shall not share personal or identifiable information with other third parties without Customer's consent. Azzule reserves the right to use data for use in preparing analytics, specific statistical comparisons, generic use in reports, presentations and other materials.
3. IDEMNIFICATION & HOLD HARMLESS. Customer acknowledges and agrees it shall indemnify, defend and hold Primus Auditing Ops, Sustainable Food Group, and Azzule Systems harmless from all claims, demands, losses, liabilities, costs, expenses, obligations and damages of every kind and nature, known and unknown, including reasonable legal fees associated with Customer's commodity and operations, irrespective of the cause or nature of the liability.
4. SUBLICENSE FOR USE OF SUSTAINABILITY STANDARD TM TRADEMARK AND NAME. Upon execution of this Agreement and the attached Addendum “A”, and after Customer receives Certification for their operation(s), Customer is granted a non-transferable and revocable sublicense to use the “Sustainability Standard TM ” and accompanying logo (collectively “Sustainability Standard Trademark”) in a manner consistent with the terms in the attached Addendum “A” and the Sustainable Food Group Sustainability Standard TM General Regulations. Customer's failure to comply with the requirements found in Addendum “A” and the General Regulations can result in suspension and/or revocation of use of the Sustainability Standard Trademark, and potentially void the agreement, all as outlined therein.
5. CONFIDENTIALITY. During the term of this Agreement, Customer and Primus Auditing Ops will come in contact with and may become familiar with certain information about each other's business practices, internal documentation, and other information deemed confidential by each party. Primus Auditing Ops will keep such confidential information about Customer confidential and shall not disclose it to any third parties outside of Primus Auditing Ops, Sustainable Food Group, Azzule Systems, and any other party that Customer requests such information be released to. Any and all information provided to Sustainable Food Group from Primus Auditing Ops will remain confidential with the exception of the company name of CP's, which SFG reserves the right to publish on the Sustainability Standard website. Likewise, Customer agrees to keep confidential information about Primus Auditing Ops and Sustainable Food Group, that it learns during the auditing process, confidential and will not discuss or divulge such information to any party other than Primus Auditing Ops and/or Sustainable Food Group. Customer further agrees not to copy, reproduce, disclose or publish any confidential information it comes across during the duration of Certification.

6. LIMITATION OF LIABILITY. Customer hereby releases Primus Auditing Ops, Azzule Systems, their respective affiliates including but not limited to employees, officers, directors, shareholders, from any loss or liability suffered by Customer, as defined below, resulting from services performed under this Agreement. Such release shall include any actual, incidental, consequential or other damages beyond amounts paid to Primus Auditing Ops for auditing performed and/or facilitated by Primus Auditing Ops. Customer further acknowledges and agrees that Primus Auditing Ops' liability is limited only to audit work performed by it, and the parties expressly acknowledge that Primus Auditing Ops is not liable for Customer's commodity, its safety, or quality. Customer further releases and holds Sustainable Food Group harmless from any liability whatsoever for the services provided under this Agreement,
7. GOVERNING LAW / VENUE. This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the State of California. In the event that it is necessary to institute any action to enforce any right granted herein or to redress any alleged breach hereof, then the exclusive venue for such action shall reside with the applicable Superior or Municipal Court located in Santa Maria, California.
8. GOVERNING AGENCY COMPLIANCE. Customer expressly acknowledges that Primus Auditing Ops and its auditors are not a governing agency, and does not set the industry standards for safety or protocol. Customer also acknowledges that Primus Auditing Ops provides results of audits and makes no representation or warranty regarding the quality of the Customer's products, facility, fields, methods, or other audited subjects, or whether it complies with regulation standards.

9. RIGHT TO REFERRAL. Customer acknowledges that Primus Auditing Ops is, or may, contract out the auditing services performed for Customer. Because an independent auditor is engaged in his/her own independent contracting business and is not an employee of Primus Auditing Ops, Primus Auditing Ops will not obtain insurance (professional liability, workers' compensation, general liability, auto, etc.) for the auditor or his/her employees. Independent auditors agree by a separate referral agreement to obtain his/her own insurance coverage and furnish a copy of the certificate of insurance to Primus Auditing Ops. Furthermore, in those instances in which an independent auditor is retained, Primus Auditing Ops will be acting in the sole capacity of an independent contractor and any information or data received will be merely transmitted between parties, making no independent judgment, representations or warranties as to the facts, observations or inferences made relative to the same. Logo use must be consistent with the SFG General Regulations, and Customer must both get permission to use the marks, and the marks themselves, from SFG.
10. TERM AND TERMINATION. This Agreement shall be good valid throughout the duration of Customer's Certification, and shall end at the time of the Certification's expiration. Provided that the representations and warranties, and ongoing obligations shall continue beyond the termination of this Agreement.
Termination for Cause. If either party fails to fulfill any term or condition of this Agreement, such failure shall constitute a breach of this Agreement by that party. The breaching Party shall have 10 calendar days from the time of receipt of written notice of such breach, to cure such breach. If after 10 days, the breaching party has not cured the breach, the non-breaching party may termination this agreement with no further obligations.
Voluntary Termination. Either party may voluntarily terminate this agreement upon fifteen days' written notice to the other party. If this Agreement is terminated by Customer, any certification granted by Primus Auditing Ops to Customer shall terminate immediately.
Termination by Customer After Desktop Review Portion of Audit. If Customer voluntarily terminated this Agreement in accordance with Section 10.b. above, but after Primus Auditing Ops has begun the desktop review portion of the audit, Customer acknowledges and agrees that it shall be responsible for, and shall pay to Primus Auditing Ops, an amount equal to ONE-THIRD (1/3) of the Audit Fee indicated in the “Audit Fee/Total Services” box on page 1 of this Agreement. Failure on Customer's behalf to do so is a material breach of this Agreement by Customer.

11 PAYMENT AND CANCELLATIONS. The Customer agrees to pay Primus Auditing Ops within 30 days of billing. All services rendered by Primus Auditing Ops are provided on a non-refundable basis. Customer acknowledges that Primus Auditing Ops will make its best effort to ensure that all invoices are correctly issued. However, should Customer note any possible errors, Customer agrees to notify our Billing Department within 10 days of the issuance of the errant invoice.
12. MODIFICATIONS. This Agreement, along with the attached addendum “A', constitutes the entirety of the Agreement with regard to the subject matter contained herein. No amendment or extension of this Agreement shall be binding on either party unless in writing and signed by both parties.

div.h1: PRIMUS AUDITING OPERATIONS SUSTAINABILITY AUDIT SERVICES AGREEMENT
CERTIFICATION PROCESS AND SUBLICENSE AGREEMENT ADDENDUM
div.p:
This addendum (“Exhibit A”) is an addition to, and the terms hereby incorporated into, the Primus Auditing Operations Sustainability Audit Services Agreement by and between Primus Auditing Ops and Customer (the “Agreement”)
Marks of Conformity
IPM Institute of North America, Inc., dba Sustainable Food Group is the legal owner of the trademark and name “Sustainability Standard TM ” and the accompanying logo (collectively “Sustainability Standard Trademark”)
Customer is granted a non-exclusive and revocable sublicense for use of the Sustainability Standard Trademark on the following conditions, all of which Contracting Party acknowledges and agrees:
Customer can only use the trademark and/or logo when there is a valid Sustainability Standard TM certificate linked to that organization and clear reference to the certified operations. The logo can only be used for business to business communications and marketing purposes (press releases, social media posts, websites, etc.), as long as the operation and crop certified are specified.
The use of the Sustainability Standard Trademark shall not appear on the product, or consumer packaging, nor shall it be used at the point of sale in direct connection to single products.
Customer, as a certified operation, will only use the Sustainability Standard Trademark in a manner consistent with the registered scope of their certification. Operations and/or products not included in the certified operations registered scope are not certified and Customer is prohibited from using the Logo in any way that would indicate or imply otherwise:
This requires that Customer be up to date in payment of all fees due by Customer to Primus Auditing Ops and Sustainable Food Group
The Sustainability Standard Trademark must be obtained from Primus Auditing Operations, in order to ensure conformance with exact corporate color and format, and may only be used in a manner consistent with Sustainability Standard TM requirements.
Customer shall at all times cooperate with Sustainable Food Group and its agents (including Primus Auditing Ops) to allow reasonable access to verify compliance with these requirements.
Sustainable Food Group or Primus Auditing Ops may suspend Customer's sublicense for use of the Sustainability Standard Trademark if, at Sustainable Food Group or Primus Auditing Ops sole discretion, it determines that:
Customer fails to comply with these rules;,
Customer fails to meet re-certification requirements;
Customer uses the logo in a manner that is detrimental to Sustainable Food Group or the Sustainability Standard TM
Customer fails to correct issues or conditions that led to suspension of Customers use of the Sustainability Standard Trademark within 15 days of notification of the violation and suspension;
Customer's certified operation ceases operations or files for bankruptcy protection.
Upon written notice to Customer of such suspension or revocation, Customer agrees to immediately discontinue using Sustainability Standard Trademark and cease use of promotional materials, websites or communications on which the Sustainability Standard Trademark is published.
In addition to suspension or revocation of the use of the Sustainability Standard Trademark as outlined in Section 6.d. above, a violation of the use of the Sustainability Standard Trademark, as outlined herein and in the Sustainability Food Group Sustainability Standard General Regulations, shall constitute a breach of the Agreement by Customer. In the event that Customer, its employees, or officers, improperly use the Sustainability Standard Trademark without the consent of Primus Auditing Ops or Sustainable Food Group, Customer shall have fifteen (15) calendar days, following written notice from Primus Auditing Ops or the Scheme Owner of the improper use, to cure the improper use. If Customer fails to cure the improper use, the Agreement is voidable by Primus Auditing Ops, and Customer's certification, and the documents associated therewith, will be immediately revoked.
Nothing herein shall be construed to relieve the parties from their respective obligations under the Agreement.
